channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Amelia

item.title: GRUs
item.description: GRU stands for Gated Recurrent Unit, which is a type of recurrent neural network (RNN) that is based on Long Short-Term memory (LSTM). Like LSTM, GRU is designed to model sequential data by allowing information to be selectively remembered or forgotten over time. However, GRU has a simpler architecture than LSTM, with fewer parameters, which makes it easier to train at a cost of accuracy

item.title: TEST
item.description:
Introduction

Problem.

Let $\lbrace R_n \rbrace_{n \ge 1}$ be a sequence of rewards and let $\alpha \in (0,1)$ be a constant step size. Consider the recursive update, for $n \ge 1$, $$Q_{n+1} = Q_n + \alpha \bigl(R_n - Q_n\bigr), \qquad Q_1 = 5, $$ where $Q_n \in \mathbb{R}$ for all $n$.

Define the auxiliary sequence $\lbrace \bar{o}_n \rbrace_{n \ge 0}$ by $$\bar{o}_n \doteq \bar{o}_{n-1} + \alpha \bigl(1 - \bar{o}_{n-1}\bigr), \quad \text{for } n > 0, \qquad \bar{o}_0 \doteq 0,$$ and let $$\beta_n \doteq \alpha \bar{o}_n.$$

item.title: TEST FILE
item.description:
Introduction

GRU stands for Gated Recurrent Unit, which is a type of recurrent neural network (RNN) that is based on Long Short-Term memory (LSTM). Like LSTM, GRU is designed to model sequential data by allowing information to be selectively remembered or forgotten over time. However, GRU has a simpler architecture than LSTM, with fewer parameters, which makes it easier to train at a cost of accuracy.
